entry.title: Pink Premier fasion show on Oct. 8
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — Douglas County Cancer Services is holding its 23rd annual Pink Premier Tea & Fashion Show on Oct. 8.

entry.title: TYEE RIDGE COMPLEX 76 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: September 16, 2023 10:00 a.m. Containment on the Tyee Ridge Complex northeast of Roseburg is now at 76 percent. Its listed at 7,939 acres. 766 people are assigned to the fire. An update from Northwest Incident Management Team 3 said while the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office has cancelled all evacuation notices for the complex, closures...

entry.title: Roseburg Library schedules basic tech classes
entry.summary: Community members are invited to register for free, basic technology classes at Roseburg Public Library.

entry.title: ROSEBURG SETS NEW RECORD HIGH FOR THE DAY ON FRIDAY
entry.summary: September 16,2023 6:20 a.m. Roseburg set a new record high for the date on Friday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 97 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The previous record high on September 15th was 95 degrees, set in 2008. Roseburg could...

entry.title: Fish enhancements, spawning salmon at Soda Springs Dam
entry.summary: TOKETEE — A public tour of the fish enhancement projects at the North Umpqua Hydroelectric Project will take place Oct. 4, hosted by Pacific Power and federal and state natural resource agencies.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 9.15.23
entry.summary: A Back to School series encore program with Superintendent Jared Cordon of Roseburg Public Schools. Click here to download for later listening: IDC 9 5 23

entry.title: STATE POLICE ENHANCING PATROL EFFORTS SATURDAY
entry.summary: September 15, 2023 12:00 p.m. The Oregon State Police will be enhancing patrol efforts on Interstate 5 between Eugene and Portland on Saturday. Extra patrols will take place on state highways and public roadways intersecting Corvallis and Eugene. Oregon State University and the University of Oregon both have home games Saturday, which will draw a...

entry.title: Reedsport Police Department to undergo retrofit, remodel
entry.summary: REEDSPORT — The Reedsport Police Department will undergo a seismic retrofit and remodel from Monday until May 31, 2024.

entry.title: SECTION OF 4TH STREET IN REEDSPORT TO BE CLOSED THROUGH MAY 2024
entry.summary: September 15, 2023 11:00 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: A contractor hired by the City of Reedsport will be performing a seismic retrofit and remodel for the Police Department beginning Monday. A section of 4th Street will be closed from Winchester Avenue in front of the police station through the end of May 2024. The...

entry.title: DCSO JAILS TRANSIENT AFTER ALLEGED DISORDERLY CONDUCT
entry.summary: September 15, 2023 10:40 a.m. Deputies with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office jailed a transient after an alleged disorderly conduct incident early Wednesday. A DCSO report said at 3:30 a.m. a caller said the woman was causing issues in the recreational vehicle park at the Douglas County Fairgrounds. When the deputy arrived, 44-year old Ariel...

entry.title: RIDDLE MAN JAILED FOR ALLEGED PRIOR ASSAULT
entry.summary: September 15, 2023 10:20 a.m. A Riddle man was jailed by the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office on Tuesday for an alleged prior assault incident. A DCSO report said on September 11th a victim said she and a man were involved in a physical altercation in the 500 block of L Street at approximately 1:00 a.m....

entry.title: CONTAINMENT OF TYEE RIDGE COMPLEX UP TO 70 PERCENT
entry.summary: September 15, 2023 10:00 a.m. The fire is listed at 7,939 acres. 876 people are assigned to the complex. An update from Northwest Incident Management Team 3 said much of the complex is in patrol status. The third day of high temperatures and low relative humidity will test control lines. Fire Behavior Analyst Greg Wagonblast...

entry.title: VEHICLE FIRE SPREADS TO VEGETATION
entry.summary: September 15, 2023 9:40 a.m. A vehicle fire spread to vegetation in the Tenmile area Thursday night. entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 9.15.23
entry.summary: Melisa Wagnon talks about plans for a Riddle Activity Center, which Riddle Roots Community Projects is hoping to build. A special kick off is happening next Tuesday. Click here to download for later listening: 830 9 15 23

entry.title: Driver cites for DUII after wreck
entry.summary: WINSTON — A driver was cited for DUII after a three-vehicle wreck Wednesday night.

entry.title: Brock Smith, Osborne announce re-election campaigns
entry.summary: Oregon Representative Virgle Osborne and Oregon Senator David Brock Smith announced Thursday they would each be filing for re-election.

author.name: Kyle Bailey and Sanne Godfrey The News-Review

entry.title: DFPA handles four fires as fire level increases
entry.summary: With the fire danger level returning to high due to hotter temperatures, crews with the Douglas Forest Protective Association dealt with four fires in the Douglas District on Thursday.

entry.title: HOT WEATHER CONTINUES, RECORD HIGH POSSIBLE FRIDAY
entry.summary: September 15, 2023 4:20 a.m. Hot weather continues in the Umpqua Valley, with the potential of setting a record high for the date on Friday. entry.title: Tickets on sale for Silent Disco fundraiser
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — Tickets are now on sale for a Silent Disco fundraiser that will be held from 6-11 p.m. Oct. 14 at Millsite Park in Myrtle Creek.

entry.title: Kiwanis Club celebrate 100 years
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Kiwanis Club of Roseburg is celebrating 100 years of service with a community event from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Saturday at the Umpqua Valley Arts Center on West Harvard Avenue.

entry.title: Douglas County Fire update: Aircraft continue efforts from the air, firefighters patrol and mopup
entry.summary: Firefighters assigned to the Tyee Ridge Complex fire have been conducting successful mop-up operations this week resulting in an overall containment of 55% while their counterparts on the Chilcoot and Ridge fires have built control lines.

entry.title: Architect firm moves out of downtown, merges with Tigard firm
entry.summary: The building is still labeled with “PAUL L BENTLEY Architect A.I.A P.C.” But the large, brick-lined room inside is empty, except for some odds and ends, and a large piano.

entry.title: Stand Down helps veterans connect to service
entry.summary: A blue table at the entrance to Roseburg’s Veteran of Foreign Wars Auxiliary Post closed the parking lot from vehicles and instead welcomed all homeless veterans to the parking lot.

entry.title: Roseburg German Band to perform at Oktoberfest
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — The Roseburg German Band will perform at Oktoberfest, hosted by the Myrtle Creek Elks Lodge, for the seventh consecutive times.

entry.title: Tackling health care workforce development

entry.title: Oakland Bridge closed to traffic next weekend
entry.summary: OAKLAND — Construction on the Oakland bridge project continues and from Sept. 22 until Sept. 25 a detour will be in place.

entry.title: Fire danger level increases to high
entry.summary: Due to the increase in expected temperatures and decrease in humidity, the Douglas Forest Protective Association is moving the fire danger level and public use restriction levels to high for all private, state, and Bureau of Indian Affairs lands within…

author.name: DREW WINKELMAIER and KYLE BAILEY The News-Review

entry.title: OSU launches food preserver training
entry.summary: OREGON — The Oregon State University Extension Service Master Food Preserver program is launching a multi-county hybrid training this fall for new volunteers.

entry.title: Chris Boice gives keynote speech at drug court graduation
entry.summary: Douglas County Commissioner Chris Boice was the keynote speaker at the 103rd drug court graduation ceremony Sept. 5.

entry.title: Winston Co-op grand opening this Friday
entry.summary: WINSTON — The Douglas County Farmers Co-op in Winston has been open since March, but this weekend it will host an official grand opening event.
